      • update

        @PUT
 @Path(value="{id}")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String update(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                                              java.lang.String id,
                                                                                              @QueryParam(value="password")
                                                                                              java.lang.String password,
                                                                                              java.lang.String metadata)
        Update an User.
        Parameters:
        id - - the id of the user you're intrested in.
        password - - the password set for the User
        metadata - - the updated JSON with User information
        Returns:
        an OK message if everything goes fine.

      • register

        @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String register(java.lang.String metadata,
                                                                            @QueryParam(value="password")
                                                                            java.lang.String password)
        Registers a new User.
        Parameters:
        metadata - - the User in JSON format
        password - - the password to use for that user
        Returns:
        the id of the new User.

      • notAllowed

        @POST
 @Path(value="{id}")
public void notAllowed()
        Not allowed. You should not call a POST method on a User id!

      • delete

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="{id}")
public java.lang.String delete(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                            java.lang.String id,
                                                            @QueryParam(value="password")
                                                            java.lang.String password)
        Deletes a User. The password is required.
        Parameters:
        id - of the user you want to delete
        password - - the password associated to the user you want to delete
        Returns:
        true if the user has been deleted
